meanings.definition: The complete natural environment in which a particular wine is produced, including factors such as the soil, topography, and climate.
meanings.sent1: The terroirs of the vineyard greatly influence the quality of the wine.
meanings.sent2: Winemakers believe that the terroirs of a region give its wines unique qualities.
meanings.sent3: The grapes seemed to dance happily in the terroirs, soaking up the sun and nutrients.
meanings.sent4: The terroirs whispered secrets to the vines, guiding them to produce exceptional grapes.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set over the terroirs, the vineyard glowed with the promise of a great harvest.

meanings.definition: The characteristic taste and flavor imparted to a wine by the environment in which it is produced.
meanings.sent1: The terroirs of the region give the wine its distinct flavor profile.
meanings.sent2: Wine enthusiasts appreciate how terroirs can create diverse wine varieties.
meanings.sent3: The terroirs seemed to play a flavorful game with the grapes, enhancing their taste.
meanings.sent4: The terroirs painted the wine with a palette of flavors, making it truly unique.
meanings.sent5: Each sip of the wine carried the essence of the terroirs, telling a story of the land.
